Class ShipRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • ShipRegistry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ShipRegistryInterface

    public class ShipRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
implements ShipRegistryInterface
    ShipRegistry is a Data Manager that keeps a list of ships. Note that this list is not precise in its naval jargon.
    Author:
    Rajashow

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ShipRegistry() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addShip(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String type, java.lang.String year, int tons, int pax, int guns, int torpedoes, int aircraft)
      The addShip method adds ships to the ShipRegistry's ArrayList, distinguishing by type, creating a ship instance of the correct type, and specifying the correct parameters according to its type.
      java.lang.String[] getShipDescriptions()
      The getShipDescriptions method is used in the GUI to set the radio button labels for basic ship types
      java.util.ArrayList<Ship> getShips()
      The getShips method returns the current shipList
      java.lang.String[] getWarshipDescriptions()
      The getWarshipDescriptions method is used in the GUI to set the radio button labels for the five warship types
      void readFile(java.io.File file)
      The readFile method reads from the input file, one line at a time, assuming each line represents data for one ship.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Create a toString method that sorts the currents ships according to the alphabetic order of the ship's name, and then iterates through the current ships and appends each ship's toString method to the string returned.
      void writeFile(java.io.File file)
      The writeFile method writes to a specified file, either creating a new file or appending to the end of an existing file.

      • getShips

        public java.util.ArrayList<Ship> getShips()

        Specified by:

      • addShip

        public void addShip(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String type,
                    java.lang.String year,
                    int tons,
                    int pax,
                    int guns,
                    int torpedoes,
                    int aircraft)
        The addShip method adds ships to the ShipRegistry's ArrayList, distinguishing by type, creating a ship instance of the correct type, and specifying the correct parameters according to its type. This method does not add in any sorted order - the ships are held in the order they are added
        Specified by:
        addShip in interface ShipRegistryInterface
        Parameters:
        name - A string representing the name of the ship
        type - A string representing one of "Cargo", "Cruise", "Warship", "Carrier", "Cruiser","Destroyer","Mine Sweeper",or "Submarine"
        year - A string representing the year launched
        tons - A string representing the number of tons of cargo (net register tonnage (NRT)) the ship can carry
        pax - A string representing the number of passengers a cruise ship can carry
        guns - A string representing the number of guns a warship can carry. "Guns" is loosely defined, not according to naval jargon
        torpedoes - A string representing the number of torpedoes a warship can carry.
        aircraft - A string representing the number of aircraft a warship can nominally carry.

      • readFile

        public void readFile(java.io.File file)
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                     java.io.IOException
        The readFile method reads from the input file, one line at a time, assuming each line represents data for one ship. It assumes that the second field is a string representing the ship type, one of "Cargo", "Cruise", "Warship", "Carrier", "Cruiser","Destroyer","Mine Sweeper",or "Submarine". It further assumes specific formats for each type of ship, as follows: Cargo: name,"Cargo",year,tons Cruise: name,"Cruise",year,passengers Warship: name,"Warship",year,guns,aircraft,torpedoes Carrier: name,"Carrier",year,aircraft Cruiser, Destroyer, and Mine Sweeper: name,type,year,guns Submarine: name,"Submarine",year,torpedoes It then calls addShip to instantiate it and add it to the ShipRegistry's ArrayList
        Specified by:
        readFile in interface ShipRegistryInterface
        Parameters:
        file - the file of type File to read from, assumed to be a csv file (comma-delimited) in the above order.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • writeFile

        public void writeFile(java.io.File file)
               throws java.io.IOException
        The writeFile method writes to a specified file, either creating a new file or appending to the end of an existing file. It iterates through ShipRegistry's ArrayList, writes one line at a time representing data for each ship. It writes the second field as a string representing the ship type, one of "Cargo", "Cruise", "Warship", "Carrier", "Cruiser","Destroyer","Mine Sweeper",or "Submarine". It further writes specific formats for each type of ship, as follows: Cargo: name,"Cargo",year,tons Cruise: name,"Cruise",year,passengers Warship: name,"Warship",year,guns,aircraft,torpedoes Carrier: name,"Carrier",year,aircraft Cruiser, Destroyer, and Mine Sweeper: name,type,year,guns Submarine: name,"Submarine",year,torpedoes
        Specified by:
        writeFile in interface ShipRegistryInterface
        Parameters:
        file - the file of type File to write to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • getShipDescriptions

        public java.lang.String[] getShipDescriptions()
        The getShipDescriptions method is used in the GUI to set the radio button labels for basic ship types
        Specified by:
        getShipDescriptions in interface ShipRegistryInterface
        Returns:
        the string array {ShipType.CARGO.toString(), ShipType.CRUISE.toString(), ShipType.WARSHIP.toString()};

      • getWarshipDescriptions

        public java.lang.String[] getWarshipDescriptions()
        The getWarshipDescriptions method is used in the GUI to set the radio button labels for the five warship types
        Specified by:
        getWarshipDescriptions in interface ShipRegistryInterface
        Returns:
        the string array {ShipType.CARRIER.toString(), ShipType.CRUISER.toString(), ShipType.DESTROYER.toString(), ShipType.MINE_SWEEPER.toString(), ShipType.SUBMARINE.toString()};

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Create a toString method that sorts the currents ships according to the alphabetic order of the ship's name, and then iterates through the current ships and appends each ship's toString method to the string returned.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
